Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.input

Class Keyboard

java.lang.Object
org.jsfml.window.Keyboard
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.input.Keyboard
public final class Keyboard extends org.jsfml.window.Keyboard
Provides access to the real-time state of the keyboard. The methods in this class provide direct access to the keyboard state, that means that they work independently of a window's focus. In order to react to window based events, use the KeyListener interface instead.

  • Method Details

    • isKeyPressed

      public static boolean isKeyPressed(@NotNull @NotNull Keyboard.Key key)
      Checks if a certain key is currently pressed on the keyboard.
      Parameters:
      key - the key in question
      Returns:
      true if the key is currently being pressed, false otherwise

    • getDirection

      public static Direction getDirection(@NotNull @NotNull Keyboard.MovementControls controls)
      Gets the direction currently inputted on the keyboard, according to the specified control setting. The inter-cardinal directions are allowed (i.e. two keys for perpendicular directions can be pressed at a time). To disable them, use the getDirection(MovementControls, Direction.Axis) method.
      Parameters:
      controls - a control setting
      Returns:
      the direction being currently inputted on the keyboard

    • getDirection

      public static Direction getDirection(@NotNull @NotNull Keyboard.MovementControls controls, @NotNull Direction.Axis priority)
      Gets the direction currently inputted on the keyboard, according to the specified control setting. Inter-cardinal directions are not allowed (i.e. two keys for perpendicular directions cannot be pressed at a time). To resolve conflicts, the specified axis is prioritized.
      Parameters:
      controls - a control setting
      priority - the axis to take priority when two keys for perpendicular directions are pressed
      Returns:
      the direction being currently inputted on the keyboard
